Posts.Content: Hi - thanks. It is reassuring to hear that you felt able to wear a swimming costume and go on holiday just four weeks after your surgery - well done to you and that makes me feel a bit more positive for my own op. Thanks for the hug and I do hope you are doing well with the rest of the treatment.
Posts.Title: scared and angry

Posts.Content: I'm new here and a bit nervous. Just diagnosed with Grade 3 invasive ductal carcinoma - whatever that means. I am due to have a WLE on 13 May and am terrified but in the meantime I have developed a breast infection following my last biopsies. I now have a solid hard breast that is desperately painful and a stinging sensation in my chest. Really worried my op will be postponed but will just have to wait for antibiotics to work. I live alone so need to arrange for help after my op. Loads of well meaning people are telling me positive stories about people who got back to work in a matter of days. Is that true? How much help am I likely to need and how long might it take to recover from the first op. I just need to deal with that part first before worrying about the chemotherapy and radiotherapy I am supposed to be having later. Ooh that was a bit of a garble. But my mind is all over the place right now! I'd appreciate any advice from anyone who has been through it, also did anyone else get one of these infections?
Posts.Title: scared and angry

Posts.Content: Thanks Von I do hope you can enjoy your holiday and try not to worry while you are away.  Best wishes Penny
